channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Young Chinese are hugging trees. Here's why
China’s obsession with Arunachal, growing defence ties with Pakistan: Why Pentagon’s report is a big worry for India
In Graphics | Who started the tradition of Christmas stockings?
How ‘bankrupt’ Pakistan stays afloat on foreign loans
Trump revamps H-1B visa lottery system. Will it hurt Indians?
Where’s Santa? How Norad uses satellites and AI to track Father Christmas
Trump’s message to Europe, Western Hemisphere: Fall in line or fall out
item.description: Breaking transatlantic ties and punishing and rewarding Latin American nations, Donald Trump makes a tectonic shift in American foreign policy

item.title: How Yunus regime has allowed Islamists to exploit Hadi’s death to target India
item.description: When mobs feel empowered to lynch and burn with impunity, it indicates not only intolerance but also the ideological confidence the radical masses imbibe, knowing that the violence they unleash will be excused, justified, or quietly ignored

item.title: How Gaza trap will make Munir realise the cost of American lunch
item.description: For Trump, the Gaza peace plan is key for his nomination for the Nobel award, and there is no way nations pressured to participate can back away. Pakistan, the only Muslim nuclear power, is expected to take the lead

item.title: How the $35 billion gas deal between Israel and Egypt makes sense for the US
item.description: Overseas wars make gun-manufacturers laugh at home; peace creates redevelopment business overseas

item.title: Bangladesh at the brink: How Islamist extremism threatens the nation’s Bengali soul
item.description: Bangladesh is approaching a point of no return. When cultural institutions burn, minorities are lynched, and jihadist flags fly unchallenged, the issue is no longer domestic instability—it is civilisational survival

item.title: India-New Zealand FTA: Why dairy is non-negotiable for Delhi in trade talks
item.description: An FTA that destabilises rural incomes and nutrition is not high-quality; it is fragile. India learned this lesson early
